page.title: 02Meriden-Village Centre.
page.content:
Meriden is the traditional centre of England and located on the village green there remains the base and a portion of{a village cross}which is reputed to mark the exact centre point.
The cross is now scheduled as an ancient monument, the view is that it was once the market cross and was transferred to its present site. This was possibly done on the orders of a former{Earl of Aylesford}as this family has always had much influence in the affairs of Meriden.
The{Bull's Head Inn}was probably the site of the market place, as it was a coaching inn on the London to Holyhead road.
